alert.note: Alert for Far Northwest Highlands; Sandia, Manzano Mountains Including Edgewood; Southern Sangre de Cristo Mountains; Southwest Mountains (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued November 29 at 9:53PM MST until December 02 at 6:00AM MST by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 AM MST SATURDAY... * WHAT...Snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 2 to 6 inches with the higher amounts along west facing slopes. * WHERE...Sandia and Manzano Mountains including Edgewood, Far Northwest Highlands, Southwest Mountains, and Southern Sangre de Cristo Mountains. * WHEN...Until 6 AM MST Saturday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. Tire traction will be reduced. Extend the distance between your vehicle and the vehicle in front of you. This includes along portions of I-40. The hazardous conditions could impact the Thursday morning and evening commutes. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Snowfall is likely to occur in several bursts, the first late tonight through Thursday morning then again Thursday night through Friday morning with potentially a third round Friday afternoon and night.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. For the latest road conditions, dial 511 or 1.800.432.4269, or visit http://nmroads.com.

area.areaDesc: Far Northwest Highlands; Sandia, Manzano Mountains Including Edgewood; Southern Sangre de Cristo Mountains; Southwest Mountains
